seniority_level.evidence: No explicit years mentioned, but responsibilities include end-to-end development, data modeling, and CI/CD practices which suggest mid-level experience. Title is 'Data Engineer' without senior/staff prefix.

job_family.evidence: Job title is 'Data Engineer' and core responsibilities focus on building and maintaining data pipelines, data warehousing, and ELT automation.

sub_specialty.evidence: Emphasis on ELT pipelines, data warehousing, Kimball methodology, and tools like DBT and Fivetran which are primarily batch-oriented. No explicit streaming technologies mentioned.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of managing people, mentoring, or technical leadership responsibilities. Focus is on individual contribution: designing, building, maintaining data infrastructure.

primary_cloud.evidence: AWS explicitly mentioned in 'AWS cloud infrastructure including AWS CDK'. Redshift and Snowflake are also listed, but AWS is the only cloud platform named directly.

secondary_clouds.evidence: BigQuery (GCP) and Redshift (AWS) are both listed, but BigQuery is a GCP service. No Azure services are explicitly mentioned, but the presence of multiple cloud data platforms suggests potential multi-cloud exposure.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ELT pipelines, data warehousing, and tools like DBT and Fivetran which are batch-oriented. No mention of Kafka, Kinesis, or real-time processing.

orchestrator_category.evidence: DBT is explicitly listed as a core technology and is central to modern data transformation orchestration. Jenkins is mentioned but likely for CI/CD, not pipeline orchestration.

storage_layer.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'Core Cloud data platforms (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)' which are data warehouses. Also mentions 'Data Warehouse/Kimball methodology'.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is Manchester, UK, and geo restriction is 'uk_only'. Hybrid model requires 50% in-office time, implying physical presence in the UK.

timezone_focus.evidence: Location restricted to Manchester, UK, and geo restriction is 'uk_only', indicating focus on UK time zones.

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requires 50% in-office time, and location is Manchester. New team members must spend initial period full-time in office, implying relocation may be required for non-local candidates.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No mention of visa sponsorship. Location is UK, and geo restriction is 'uk_only', suggesting local work authorization required.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visas or OPT/CPT. UK-based role with 'uk_only' restriction implies work authorization required, which typically excludes student visas.

citizenship_required.evidence: No explicit citizenship requirement, but 'uk_only' geo restriction and hybrid work model imply authorization to work in the UK is required.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is 'full_time' and 'permanent', with comprehensive benefits including pension, healthcare, and share awards, which are typical of W2 employees.

benefits_level.evidence: Extensive benefits list including equity (share awards), learning budget (ongoing technical training, professional qualification support), generous PTO (25-31 days), private healthcare, pension matching, and unique perks like free gym, bike loan, and social events.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'Talent development programmes' and 'Ongoing technical training', suggesting growth opportunities, but no explicit career tracks or promotion ladder described.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions joining a 'dynamic and experienced Data Engineering team' and collaborating with stakeholders, implying opportunities to learn from senior colleagues, but no formal mentorship program mentioned.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression paths in the job description or benefits section.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within the company.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks. Career development is implied but not structured.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between must-have and nice-to-have skills. Must-have list is extensive (15 items) but includes a mix of tools and methodologies. Soft skills are emphasized but not overly restrictive.

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering responsibilities: ELT pipelines, data warehousing, data modeling, and platform maintenance. No indication of hybrid roles (e.g., data scientist or analyst).

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skills listed (Snowflake, DBT, Python, AWS, etc.) are reasonable for a mid-level data engineer. No unrealistic combinations or excessive years of experience required.
